data.description:
EasyWake makes waking up in the morning much less stressful. Instead of almost having a heart attack every morning from your alarm, you can use EasyWake to wake up peacefully. EasyWake tries to slowly wake you up by sending short vibrations in a repeated pattern. It sends vibrations at 4:00, 4:20, 5:00, 5:20, 5:40, and 6:00 AM. All you have to do is leave EasyWake open on your Pebble Watch while you sleep. The app is set to fully wake you up at 6:00 AM, so you do not need to set an alarm on your watch. Wake up easy with EasyWake. 

*If popular request, I will add a way to set what time you want to wake up :)

data.description:
This is a Deadfish interpreter for Pebble!

Deadfish is a very odd interpreted programming language created by Jonathan Todd Skinner. It was released under public domain and was originally programmed in C, but now it has been since ported to many other programming languages.

Deadfish has a way to output things but it has no way to input them! It has only a few commands, only four in total. 

- Press "Up" for the "i" command (increment accumulator)
- Press "Down" for the "d" command (decrement accumulator)
- Press "Select" for the "s" command (square accumulator)
- Press "Back" for the "o" command (output accumulator)

Additionaly you may also:
- Long press "Select" to delete your program 
- Long press "Back" to exit the application

Please refer to the Deadfish website for more details about programming in Deadfish: http://esolangs.org/wiki/deadfish

❤ Give us a heart if you like Deadfish!

The Deadfish logo comes from clker.com.
We are NOT affiliated with Jonathan Todd Skinner, esolangs.org nor clker.com

latest_release.release_notes: Force Aplite to use 32 bits integer because of the lack of support for %llu in SDK2

data.description:
Create reminders on your Pebble watch the easiest possible way. 

## Idea

Dumb, repetitive and mechanical tasks (doing the dishes, taking a shower, driving to work, jogging, what-have-you) are always a good opportunity for my mind to wander, and often the times when ideas sprout and *to-do*'s come back to mind. When those ideas come up, my usual way to treat them is to postpone them to after the task at hands, as I'm probably not in a position to take notes (hands are wet, or on the wheel, etc.).
Unfortunately, most of the times I fail to remember the idea when I get in better disposition to write it down, or to process it.

**RemindMe** is my solution to this problem. My own digital way, always on my wrist, to tie a knot to my handkerchief, to tie a string around my index finger, or to throw a slipper, a book, or any other unusual item in the middle of the room's floor.

## How it works

At the moment **RemindMe**'s main screen is a list of all your notes, which you can enter to display in full or delete, and a way to add dictated notes. I suggest you link a Quick Launch button to **RemindMe**, so that you can open the "new note" dictation screen in only one long click from your watchface.

## Features

Version 1.0 only includes a quick note system that allows you to create time-stamped text notes.

latest_release.release_notes: Fix a bug that prevented dictation session to work multiple times.

data.description:
Koishi - 小石 is a Pebble Watchapp for the japanese learning service called WaniKani, which teaches Japanese to tens of thousands of users by utilizing a well known learning mechanism called Spaced-Learning-Repetition (SRS). Combining this learning system with the watchapp, one can more immerse themselves in this target language.




You will need a japanese language pack for your Pebble to correctly display japanese characters on the screen. I recommend this free package http://wh.to/pebble/wiki.php but consider donating to the author.

With this watchapp you will be able to choose between showing the recent unlocks words or the critical items. Show a different word each minute with the 'automode' or manually, first the japanese word and later the pronunciation and meaning on the click of a button. You could configure the watchapp to use the darktheme, if it suits better with your pebble style than the light theme.




If you have suggestions or encounter any problem, contact me and I'll help you.



If you find this watchapp usefull, please consider making a donation : 12WqEENZgRGCLpRYiuutuAT3WsmCFS2BBQ

data.description: A 'simple to use' dual time zone watch which does not use geolocation (saving battery). Instead simply use the top and bottom buttons to set the top time. The bottom time is always set to the current phone time. The middle button flips the home and globe icon to match the bottom time to your location (home or away). If you are home and your contact is away set the bottom icon to home and adjust the top time to their time zone. If you are away, flip the icon to the globe and set the top time to your normal home time zone.

data.description:
A simple app to keep track of whose turn it is next. Tracks up to six names.

Hold down the select button to change modes, press to perform the selected action.

COLOR: Opens the color selector for the selected name.

ADD: Click select to add a new name to the bottom of the list.

DELETE: Delete the selected name.

RESET: Reset the order to default.

data.description:
If you want to master guitar chords, Chord Magic is for you.

To input a chord, use the Up and Down buttons to change what's played on a string: open, muted, or a particular fret. Tap Select to move to the next string. For every position, Chord Magic tells you the chord name, the notes played, and the chord spelling, which helps you understand how the chord is constructed and how to change it.

Chord Magic examines the actual notes to determine the chord, so it's not limited to the chords you find in books. In fact, it was designed to help play in alternative tunings. To change the tuning, press and hold the Select button to switch to tuning mode. There, you can adjust each string's pitch by using Up and Down, and use Select to move strings. You can set any tuning you want, and Chord Magic will confirm when it recognizes certain common tunings. The tuning feature can set a Capo as well by moving all strings up a fixed number of frets. Once your tuning is set, press and hold Select again to return to Chord Mode.
data.title: Chord Magic

So there's some good news and some great news:

The good news is that Slate is now more stable than ever, with several pesky bugs squashed in recent development. Like setting a reminder "at noon" returning an error for some odd reason. 

The great news is that Slate is more approachable for new users with a, hopefully, helpful onboarding screen before creating your first reminder. This should make it a bit simpler to get started with Slate. 


Coming soon:

In the works:
- Spanish support

The first release! 

Welcome to the beginning of Slate, a voice-powered, smart assistant for Pebble. Right now Slate can create reminders and place them in the Pebble Timeline, just by telling it. This makes Slate a handy quick-launch app, so it can be accessible as soon as you need it. 

What's slated next?

- Create quick calendar events.
- Setup timers in a pinch.
- Ask and you may receive!

data.description:
Were you in a situation where you need to check the time discreetly? For example, when you are on date or in a movie theater where you can't check the time because it is rude or feel uncomfortable. @Morse Code for Pebble is here to help. It will vibrate and tell the time in Morse Code. (International Morse Code) 
1 = . - - - - 
2 = . . - - - 
3 = . . . - - 
4 = . . . . - 
5 = . . . . . 
6 = - . . . . 
7 = - - . . . 
8 = - - - . . 
9 = - - - - . 
0 = - - - - - 
: = - - - . . .

@Morse Code for Pebble will vibrate was soon as you launch the Watchapp and displays the time with Morse Code.  Assign the @Morse Code to a Quick Launch button will be the most discreet.  You can also press Up/Down/Select button to vibrate to tell time again.  What's more, you can use this Watchapp as an educational Morse Code learning tool.
data.title: @MorseCode for Pebble

data.description:
Mastermind is a classic puzzle game. 
Guess the sequence, get your hit/miss score and make a better guess, until you find the correct code.
If you can't find it in 6 rounds, the solution will be displayed.

If many users like the game, I will start the multiplayer project, so you can play against other pebble users.

Keys:
Down- change to next shape(Right)
Up- move to update another shape
Select- Get hit/miss score for the current combination. (at end, start a new game
Back- Move back to previous shape. Exit if in Left-most shape(or after win/lose)

Future plans:
- Let user select colors/shapes
- Count Won/lost
- Add bulls and cows version (numbers 0-9)
- Multiplayer game
- Select shapes using voice

I'm open to user suggestions. I will add features according to what more users are interested in.

data.author: Peter Summers

changelog.release_notes: Reduced the GPS timeout from nine to four seconds to avoid incorrect readings when running for five seconds.
Offers an option to get the location only on request, which disables all the watch and phone times to save battery.

Car mode defaults to on for the Pebble 2.
Orientation returns to north at top when car mode is turned off.
"..." indicates no compass reading rather than "!!!" (which looked messy).
Increases the allowed length of locations from 48 to 63 characters.
Tidied up the message given after choosing a new location.
More help on the configuration page.

Now uses Clay for its configuration settings, which means you don't need to have mobile data coverage when you access the configurations - unless you use the Google address resolution function, of course.

Saves the coordinates for an address when it's been looked up by Google so that it won't need to be again.

Fixes a bug with locations with more than 40 characters.

Allows a different sampling interval to be specified when the target location is nearer than the proximity alert distance - e.g. once per minute until the target is within 300 metres, then once every ten seconds.
Fix for phones that return a heading when the speed is zero.
Fixes an minor cosmetic issue with the direction pointer.
Cleaned up the compass face display code.
Support for the larger screen on the Pebble Time 2.

Car mode is now remembered between sessions.

Workaround for compass bug removed, as the new firmware that fixes it has been our for several weeks now.  If you suffer crashes, make sure your firmware is 4.1.x.
Fixes the compass issue when toggling car mode.

Fixes a problem with not being able to request information or send pins twice.  

Removes the default to car mode setting, which was where I'd introduced the problem and which isn't as necessary now as I have a better workaround for the compass bug.
Tweaked the compass bug workaround to improve battery life.

Puts the destination description on the menu as an app glance.

Works around the compass bug in SDK4.0.

Doesn't turn the compass on until it's asked for, so that Car Mode can be turned on to avoid a compass bug with Pebble OS 4.0.

Also supports Pebble 2 (which has no compass).

If the compass bug is a big problem to you, look at https://github.com/Freeyourgadget/Gadgetbridge/wiki/Pebble-Firmware-updates for details of how to downgrade.
Adds a setting that allows Car Mode to default to on or off.

latest_release.release_notes: Reduced the GPS timeout from nine to four seconds to avoid incorrect readings when running for five seconds.

data.description:
Add (future) reminders and (past) notes to your watch timeline using the microphone.

HOW TO USE:
Add reminders by saying:

"Remind me to go swimming at 4pm"
"Swimming lesson in 2 hours and 15 minutes"
"At 4 o'clock go swimming"
"Swimming at 4 tomorrow"

Add past and current notes by saying:

"Note that I left home at 8am"
"I took my pills 5 minutes ago"
"Just fed the parking meter"

The key to determine whether an event is in the past is if the sentence starts with "Note", or if the word "ago" proceeds the time like "1 minute ago", or if no time exists.

Undo the last event added by saying:

"Cancel that"
"Cancel last"
"Undo"

NATURAL LANGUAGE:
You can also use natural language like "remind me at 4:30 to buy tickets" or you can use concise language like "buy tickets at 4:30". Both will result in the text "buy tickets" in your timeline set at 4:30.

DESIGN:
This app is designed to be used with minimal interaction. After speaking your command, it will be added to the timeline immediately without requiring any confirmation buttons to be pressed. If the command was successful, the watch will give off a double vibration. If an error occurs, it will give off a long vibration.

RESPONSIVENESS:
Events on the timeline may take up to 15 minutes to show up.

MISC:
All events are pushed to your Pebble timeline and not saved elsewhere.

If you set the app as as a quick launch shortcut, it closes the app after the event is added.

UPDATES:
Due to Pebble discontinuing the timeline and the microphone which are 2 critical infrastructures, this app will no longer be updated.

latest_release.release_notes: Fixed noon time as PM and support Emery.

data.description:
Check realtime/scheduled transit times for the Greater Cleveland Regional Transit Authority (GCRTA) on your watch. Save frequently uses stops as favorites for quick & easy access. You can also select the color you like best

Performance Notice:
This app uses pebble.js which, according to Pebble, is still in beta. This is important to know because the app can be slow at times and it may not start up right the first time resulting in a screen that says "Disconnected, run the pebble app". The app has been tested and it does work but it may not work well at times. The app also makes round trip communication with your phone for each interaction. This uses up more battery on the watch which is why it is recommended to save frequently used stop.

Service Notice:
This app relies on data provided by the GCRTA which may change or be discontinued at any time. In the event the data is changed or discontinued the app will stop working for some time. Please do not contact the GCRTA about these issues as this app is not maintained by them.

data.description:
A checklist—on your watch!

Thanks to the Pebble’s microphone and voice input, it’s now possible to keep track of anything on your wrist! Designed to stay out of your way, use Checklist to keep track of anything you need without needing to hold your phone—things to-do, shopping, and more!

Grocery shopping will never be the same.

- Want to add multiple items at once? Just separate those items with periods or commas! (For example, saying "milk comma eggs comma cheese" will create 3 list items!)

- Don't want to use voice? Now you can enter items manually via your phone on the configuration page!

Like the app? Please "heart" it!

"...only one app, a simple list-making app called Checklist, which uses the watch’s microphone to add tasks, really proved useful."
—MIT Technology Review

"I loved the convenience of adding items to the Checklist app just by speaking"
—Tom's Guide

******
Note: If voice isn't working, make sure your Pebble Time app is the newest version (3.6.1 on Android,  3.3.1 on iOS) and that your Pebble is running firmware 3.6 or higher. You can check under "Support" in the Pebble Time app.

data.description:
VoiceNote allows you to easily save notes to your watch with your voice. An easy to use menu makes it easy to navigate and select your desired option. 

To Create a Note:
- Open the App
- Click Select to go to Menu
- Click Up to create a new note
- Speak the Title
- Speak the Subtitle 

To Expand a Note:
- Highlight Note you want to Expand
- Click Select to go to Menu
- Click Expand Menu

To Delete a Note:
- Hold Select when the note you want to delete is highlighted.

Many more features will be coming in a future updates. Please message me if you find any bugs or want to suggest a feature.

If you like the app, please consider donating here http://bit.ly/VoiceNoteDonate
data.title: Voice Note
